description: Welcome to Documentation.js, a lightweight library built to transform structured JSON into beautiful, interactive documentation. What you are reading right now is generated by the same system no hand-written HTML, only clean data turned into styled sections.

text: This library is designed to document your codebases and projects in a modular way. Each entry in the JSON schema becomes a rendered element: titles, descriptions, lists, images, or code snippets. The goal is to provide a single source of truth for documentation that is both flexible and visually consistent.

text: Try exploring the documentation tree with your keyboard. Use Tab, Enter, and Arrow keys to open and navigate sections. This system was carefully designed to ripple focus in and out of nested trees so users can browse without needing a mouse. Please test these features and see how the library keeps documentation truly inclusive.

Open up one of the side navigation items to load deeper documentation pages. Or try selecting a code snippet, copying it, and pasting it elsewhere. Everything here is meant to be as usable as it is presentable.
